title: A Reason To Fight

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Are you sure about this, Micaiah? This makes absolutely no sense.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: The Daein Royal Army will answer Begnion's request and attack the Laguz Alliance at the Ribahn River. Those are our orders from King Pelleas. As his subjects, we will obey him.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Without even asking why? Daein is finally on its own. Why are we even speaking to Begnion, let alone fighting for them?!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I don't know. I do know that King Pelleas wants what's best for Daein...just like us. He must know something we don't. I trust him. He's changed since the coronation, though. He doesn't smile or laugh anymore. Maybe it's because Izuka and the Black Knight vanished.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Who cares about Pelleas smiling or laughing? We have no quarrels with the Laguz Alliance! Why are we targeting them?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Well, with a few exceptions, the soldiers are excited about hunting down the laguz... They've been promised a large bounty for each one they kill. It's certainly raised morale.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Listen to yourself! Laguz hunting?! That's just great. We've gone from being freedom fighters to bigots in the blink of an eye. I can't believe you'd go along with such a murderous plan. How do you feel about this, Micaiah? Tell me the truth.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: ...I don't want to fight.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Then why ar--

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: What choice do I have?! I'm the general of this army. It doesn't matter how I feel. Besides, I can't let the king or the soldiers down. My duty ultimately lies with them... I'm sorry.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Following Pelleas's orders is the same as approving of them.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Sothe, you don't have to do this. I heard that your friend Ike is fighting on the side of the Laguz Alliance. Go, fight with them. Or don't fight at all. But don't let me force you into anything.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: I'm not leaving your side. I swore I'd protect you, no matter what. I keep my promises. If I can't talk you out of this insanity, I'll fight Commander Ike and his men.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Sothe...

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: But we'd better prepare ourselves. This fight will be harder than any we've had before.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Thank you. I know this isn't easy. But if one side must fall, I will do all I can to make sure it is not Daein. I have no other choice.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: We've just begun crossing the river. This fog worries me. I can't see the other side at all.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: When we first crossed this river, it was in triumph, thanks to that tiny strategist... Ranulf: C'mon, Skrimir... You're hurting morale.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: I was defeated. By a beorc. How can I return to Gallia with this shame? If only I had died, I wouldn't have to suffer this humiliation!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Skrimir, stop. If you had died, Gallia would have lost a brave soldier.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Brave? I am a failure... Please. Leave me alone.

intro.speaker: Lyre
intro.line: Hey, Kyza... Do you smell that?

intro.speaker: Kyza
intro.line: I can't smell anything. What is it?

intro.speaker: Lyre
intro.line: Hm. Maybe it's just my imagination.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Think hard. What kind of smell?

intro.speaker: Lyre
intro.line: Hello, Captain Ranulf! Um, well... Let's see. What IS that smell? Oh, I know! It smells like one of those torches that the beorc use!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: What?!

intro.speaker: Kyza
intro.line: Are we being pursued? I don't smell any beorc.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: That's because the wind is blowing from the other side. Oh no... I have a bad feeling about this. Call a halt on the river crossing! Kyza, Lyre! Go tell everyone else. I'll make a run for the lead force and let them know! I just hope it's not too late!

intro.speaker: Lyre
intro.line: No... No! The enemy is here? No way!

intro.speaker: Kyza
intro.line: Lyre, run to the left wing and inform them of the situation.  Lyre!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Not yet. Wait for them to get closer. Everyone, stay quiet...

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: There's the lead force!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Everyone! Take your positions! Attack!

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: Blast! We're being ambushed! Grr... Turn back! Brothers, turn back!

battle.speaker: Gallia
battle.line: Never!

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: What did you just say?!

battle.speaker: Gallia
battle.line: We're the beast tribe! I'd rather die than be a coward!

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: ...Fine. No pulling back. We stay here and fight to the last. All forces, attack!

battle.speaker: Ranulf
battle.line: Lethe, you idiot! Why won't you fall back?!

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: The soldiers think that if we retreat any longer, we'd be throwing away our pride.

battle.speaker: Ranulf
battle.line: You're following the lead of some blood-crazed soldiers? You're supposed to be in charge!

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: I know that retreat is the sane course of action, Ranulf. But if we run now, we'd lose the values we hold dearest in our hearts!

battle.speaker: Ranulf
battle.line: ...Fine, Lethe. As long as it's your decision, not someone else's. I'll join the others in the back and watch over Skrimir. We're counting on you!

battle.speaker: Lyre
battle.line: Lethe! Are you out here? Where are you?

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: Lyre! What are you doing here?!

battle.speaker: Lyre
battle.line: Lethe! Oh, Lethe! You're safe! I'm so glad you're all right!

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: Why are you sneaking around?! Get back into position!

battle.speaker: Lyre
battle.line: What?! How dare you! I was just... Oh, forget it! I don't care what happens to you anyway!

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: I'm sorry, Lyre. It's much too dangerous here. Get back in position. Now.

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: Sir Knight! You're safe! But where have you been?

battle.speaker: Black Knight
battle.line: My maiden. I shall not ask why you choose to engage in this battle.

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: For that, you have my thanks.

battle.speaker: Black Knight
battle.line: I am here to protect you. There need be no other reason. Do not leave my side.

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: I understand. Then I shall not ask you why you have been absent. I want you to know, I'm happy to see you again. I am very glad you're safe.

boss.speaker: Lethe
boss.line: Grr... Their defenses are strong. We can't push through them. But we can't pull back! Retreat is not an option! I'll give my life to uphold the honor of the beast tribe!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: This is pointless. The Gallian soldiers just keep coming, no matter how many we take down. If we keep this up, both sides will take horrible casualties.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Grr, I can't find an opening! If only I could find one weak point, we could break through!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: These guys are really clever. They must have a veteran commander to use a strategy like this.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Ranulf! But, what about General Skrimir?! Isn't he supposed to be at the back of the army?

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: You know how he is. I've got six strong men trying to keep Skrimir from coming out here.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: All right, then. We'll show these beorc a real fight. We should regroup, and...

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Wait. Look, over there.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: All troops, lower your weapons! I'm going to propose a cease-fire to the Laguz Alliance.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: I've seen that black armor before. You're with the Daein army! Why is Daein attacking us?!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Are you the general of this army? I am Micaiah, a general of the Daein Royal Army.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Wait, you're the one in command?!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: My king, Pelleas, has decided to answer Begnion's request for help in fighting the Laguz Alliance. You have no chance for victory. Further bloodshed is meaningless. Please surrender while you can.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Do not insult us, tiny beorc! We'd rather die than surrender!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Behind you lies the Begnion army. In front of you is the Daein army. You've nowhere to run.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Well, I guess we'll just have to chase you down like cattle and press on. Sound good to you, Skrimir?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: What in the goddess's name was that?!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Get back, Micaiah! That roar... That must be a lion! Lion laguz are stronger than the cat or tiger laguz we've been fighting.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Hey... Is that you, Sothe? You look so much older now. Beorc grow up so fast... Just like Ike. Remember him, Sothe?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: What? So Commander Ike really IS fighting with you?!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Let's just say you shouldn't assume that you can see all of our troops. Sothe, if you care for this girl at all, get her and her men out of here. That's my only warning to you.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Wait!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Stop, Micaiah. If we chase them, they'll kill us for sure.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: General Tauroneo! What brings you out here? Has something happened to the king?

end.speaker: Tauroneo
end.line: No, I am here to deliver supplies. ...And to see how the battle fares.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: You made up a clever excuse and convinced the king to let you come here? I'm impressed. Thanks for coming, General Tauroneo.

end.speaker: Tauroneo
end.line: Don't worry about it. I trust that the fight is going well against the Laguz Alliance?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Yes, but the enemy seems to have additional forces deployed in the area. I expect another battle to begin very soon, and I doubt it will be as easy as the last.

end.speaker: Tauroneo
end.line: So, we still remain on the brink of battle. I see.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I shall do my best to defeat the Laguz Alliance quickly. When this battle is over, please persuade the king to negotiate a peace treaty as soon as possible. Would you do this for me? Would you please talk to the king and help to stop this pointless war?

end.speaker: Tauroneo
end.line: I shall try...

narration: The Daein army takes to the field and deals a heavy blow to the army of the Laguz Alliance. This sudden aggression shocks the Alliance like a lightning bolt on a clear day.

With their only avenue of retreat blocked, the forces of the Laguz Alliance begin to despair. As the last shred of hope is fading, Skrimir appears before his troops and rallies them on, bolstering their failing strength. Gallian morale is further improved by the appearance of Tibarn and Ike's forces, who aid the beast army with talon and steel.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I wonder what this is?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Let me see. Ah, that’s a master crown. King Pelleas got one especially for you.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: How do you use it?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: He said that a beorc who honed their combat skills could use it to gain further power.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Someone who has refined their skills. I see. So, not everyone can use it.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Sounds like it. It’s a very precious item, so choose the recipient with care.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: All right.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Here you go, Jill. This weapon is for you.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: ...Thank you. Um... Lady Micaiah, I have to ask. What is the purpose of this war?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: King Pelleas has decided to come to the aid of Begnion.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Has he deigned to share his reasoning with you? Micaiah, this war is madness! Why would he ask us to aid Begnion!?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: ...I don’t know.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Wonderful.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I believe in our king. That’s all I can say.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: At least someone does.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Edward, I have something for you...

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Really? What is it?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: It’s a gift from King Pelleas. One of Daein’s national treasures, the blade Caladbolg.

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: What? Whoa, this thing is amazing! I’ve never seen a blade so sharp! Is it really for me? That means the king’s counting on me, right? Well, Caladbolg and I won’t let him down!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Um... Listen, Edward, this war... Daein really shouldn’t be...

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Huh? Shouldn’t be what?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Oh, never mind. It’s nothing. Forget I said anything.

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: OK, sure. Um, Micaiah? Look, I don’t know anything about kings, or nobles, or anything else like that. But you’re fighting because you believe it’s what’s best for Daein, right? And, well, that’s good enough for me. I’m with you, no matter what.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Oh, Edward...

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Now, I want to use this sword! They’re going to write song about me after this, I just know it!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Leonardo, King Pelleas asked me to present you with this bow. This is Lughnasadh. It’s been stored away in the vaults of Daein, waiting for someone worthy enough. It’s more powerful than the purest silver bow.

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: It’s beautiful... Honestly, this bow is beyond my skill. It was crafted for better hands than mine. I guess... I guess we really have to win now, don’t we?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Yes, I suppose we do.

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: Don’t look so sad, Micaiah. You’re not responsible for this war. We’re doing the best we can hope to do. But I’m fighting for Daein. The circumstances may change, but my feelings never will.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Hello, Nolan. A gift from King Pelleas has arrived for you.

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: You’re kidding me... it can’t be! That’s Tarvos, isn’t it? That’s one wicked-looking axe. I’d heard stories about the fabled axe of Daein, but to actually feel the heft... King Pelleas wants me to have it? I always did like that man. I’ll take good care of it, don’t you worry.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I know you will, Nolan. King Pelleas does too. That’s why he’s chosen to give it to you.

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: Micaiah, look... I know how hard it is to be a commander, especially with all of this confusion and doubt flying around. Fighting a war you don’t believe in is a bitter pill to swallow.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Nolan, I--

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: Just remember something, will you? We’re still the Dawn Brigade. Lots of us aren’t your "comrades," we’re your family. If you need anything, we’re with you, no matter what. Nothing’s going to change that.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Oh, Nolan... Thank you so much.
